fields.description:
h3. Summary
SLA report displays all tickets including ticket which do not have any SLA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an SLA for Time to First Response with a goal 
#* Priority: Critical, Goal: 2H, Calendar: 24/7 Calendar (Default)
#* Priority: All remaining Issues, Goal: no target, Calendar: 24/7 Calendar (Default)
# Create an issue with Priority: Low
# Create a report with Series: Time to first response (Avg.), Filter by specific issue {{priority = Low}}

h3. Expected Results
Issue does not have any SLA. Issue does not appear in SLA report for Time to first response
h3. Actual Results
Issue does not have any SLA. Issue appears in SLA report for Time to first response

h3.Workaround
No workarounds
fields.summary: SLA report displaying tickets without SLA

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you copy/paste multiple images into a request in the customer portal (ctlr + c / ctrl + v or using the mouse's right button) Jira will only upload one image.

h3. Environment
Jira Service Desk Cloud (customer portal).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select multiple images in a folder and copy them;
# Paste them into a comment field in a request in the customer portal. 

h3. Expected Results
Jira will upload all the images selected.

h3. Actual Results
Jira will upload only one image.

h3. Workaround
Using the browse files and the drag and drop feature is working correctly.
fields.summary: Pasting multiple images at the same time will create only one attachment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users who are members of administration groups and doesn't have a JIRA license won't have permission to create issue via email.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user with *administrators* group 
 # Then, add the user to Jira Service Desk project customer list.
 # Then, send an email to Jira Service Desk email request

h3. Expected Results

Email create an issue
h3. Actual Results

Failed to create issue . Error display :-
{noformat}
You are not authorized to access this Service Desk. {noformat}
h3. Notes
 - This is similar with  Administrators without JIRA access cannot access portal (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5277) bug
 - You won't be able to raise tickets on behalf of the user.
fields.summary: Administrators without JIRA access cannot raised issue via email

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a custom field (user picker) to the Customer Portal in Service Desk, customers are unable to use the user picker (even if they the Global Permission *Browse Users*)

h3. Environment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field that utilizes the user picker
# Add custom field to a Service Desk Project Request Type
# Ensure that Service Desk Customers are listed in Global Permissions *Browse Users*

h3. Expected Results
User Picker works 

h3. Actual Results
User Picker does not appear. Field is a plain text field
 
h3. Notes
Even adding *Anyone* to the Global Permission *Browse Users* does not work.
In previous version of JIRA, this used to work 
ex: JIRA 7.1 & Service Desk 3.1.1 

h3.Workaround
Changing permission of users that can share as follows allows for customers to browse users in the customer portal:

 !image-2017-02-01-10-58-26-907.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Browse Users Permission Does Not Work For Customers in Service Desk Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Images attached to page shared as KB article do not show for external users. This seems to be a holdover from HOT-82673.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a KB article with images
# Check KB article via the portal. 

h3. Expected Results
KB article should load with all images
h3. Actual Results
Broken image icons replace images. Dev console shows Internal Server Error (500)
fields.summary: Images attached to page shared as KB article do not show

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a KB article contains a video file, this will play fine in Confluence, but will not play back through the portal view of the customer.
Note: it works fine as the user is an Atlassian Account user, it doesn't if the user is a portal only user.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in a Confluence space that is linked as a KB
# Add a short video to the page using the Multimedia Macro
# View the article from the portal as a portal only user

h3. Expected Results
Video should play fine in both Confluence and Jira SD

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-02 at 4.48.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 
It works from Confluence, doesn't start/work from the JSD portal
 

h3. Notes
The tests were made using an mp4 format video.

h3.Workaround
Embed the video as an attachment macro in the page content, the portal only users are then able to download the video.
fields.summary: Multimedia macro with a video doesn't work for portal only user from the portal in a KB article

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA is not checking if an incoming email has an empty/missing _MESSAGE-ID_ since this is an edge case that should never happen (by definition each email should have a _MESSAGE-ID_ that is the unique identifier for that email).

However, we have seen this happening and this caused issues in case a user replies to his own email having Jira in CC. In this case indeed an email with an empty _IN-REPLY-TO_ header is created and, in case this email has no issue key in the subject, instead of creating a new issue it will be added as a comment to whatever issue ever received a comment added from an email with no _MESSAGE-ID_

h3. Environment
This issue happened in JIRA Service Desk Cloud, but the class handling this if from JIRA Core

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Somehow send an email with no message-id to JIRA, see that this will create a new issue without any problem (no errors returned)
# With a different user (e.g. USER B) send an email to some other user (USERS C and D)  and JIRA in CC (no issue key in the subject)
# As one of the other users, e.g. USER D, reply to the email from previous step leaving Jira in CC (so, still no issue key in the subject)
# Still as USER D, reply to your own email from previous step. This will generate an email still having Jira in CC and no issue key in the subject. Also, in some cases this email will have an empty _IN-REPLY-TO_ header as the below one:
{noformat}
From: USER B
To: JIRA
References: <the MESSAGE-ID of the first email of the thread is in here> 
In-Reply-To: 
Subject: RE: test 
{noformat}
 

h3. Expected Results
# The email with empty _MESSAGE-ID_ should be discarded and an error returned by JIRA. 
# The email with empty _IN-REPLY-TO_ either creates a new ticket, or adds a comment to the issue that matches the _MESSAGE-ID_ in the _REFERENCES_ header

h3. Actual Results
# The email with empty _MESSAGE-ID_ creates a new issue and the empty _MESSAGE-ID_ is stored in JIRA DB.
# The email with empty _IN-REPLY-TO_  adds a comment to the issue created from the email in previous step.


h3.Workaround
None at the moment. However, again, this should never happen but as written in https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Message-ID:
{quote}
Message-IDs are required to have a specific format which is a subset of an email address[2] and to be globally unique. That is, no two different messages must ever have the same Message-ID. A common technique used by many message systems is to use a time and date stamp along with the local host's domain name, e.g., 950124.162336@example.com.[3] On the other hand, if two messages have the same Message-ID, they are presumed to be the same one and one version is discarded. But, as Google MTAs (message transfer agents) mangle the ones of Outlook, several same messages may coexist with original and mangled ones and create problems in referencing each other for threading 
{quote}
fields.summary: JIRA does not check for incoming emails with missing/empty message-id and stores an empty string in the DataBase

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers are looking for a way to report on trends in their Service Desk Projects based on the number of Requests Created per hour of the day over a given timeline (say last 30 days). 

For example:
|9 - 10 am | 15 Requests|
|10 - 11 am | 30 Requests|
etc

h3. Suggested Solution
Include a reporting option that displays Requests/Issues Created Grouped by Created Hour over a timeframe

h3. Why this is important
Current Service Desk reports consolidate based on the Date rather than aggregates multiple dates together; we can see everything created Today per hour (if the Past 48 hours option is used) but on a Past 7+ Day View, we can only see totals for the Day.

A report like this would help customers to identify trends and peak hours of input in their Service Desk projects
 
h3. Workaround 
Export the data and manipulate it using an External Program
fields.summary: Include a Report for Hourly Trends

fields.description:
h3. *Issue Description*

When we create an automation rule, it would be nice if we could include some other variables besides the ones that are already available in the THEN parameters.

h3. *Steps to reproduce:*
Create a custom automation rule as follow:
*WHEN:*
* Issue created

*THEN:*
* Independent of the parameter chosen. Have the ability to add more variables/custom fields values.

h3. *Actual Result:*
There are a few hardcoded variables available.

h3. *Suggested Solution:*
It would be nice if we could add more variables and/or custom fields values to these variables.
fields.summary: Add more variables to THEN automation rules
"Configuring the issue detail view" page not rendering includes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the current Service Desk setup, the mail audit log does not have the "To" column made available to track if the email being sent from the customers fall into the custom domain or if they are using the default Jira Service Desk Mail Handler for usage. For example, an instance has [support@jira.net|mailto:support@jira.net] and [support-atlassian@jira.com|mailto:support-atlassian@jira.com] , both channels to send email into, customers can respond to [support+support@jira.net|mailto:support+support@jira.net] or [test+support@jira.net|mailto:test+support@jira.net] via aliases and the emails will still be sent to one location. The "To" column is to help figure out which alias is being used for auditing purpose.
fields.summary: Add "To" Column In The JIRA Service Desk Mail Audit Log

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attaching a screenshot in an issue from Queue screen, it will refresh the browser content. If the customer already type in a text in the comment field and attaching the screenshot, the comment field will be cleared.

h3. Why this is a problem
Data loss as contents of the comment box are lost upon what appears to be a forced page refresh

Any browser
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Jira Service Desk Queue
 # Click an issue to view it
 # Type in a text in comment field.
 # Get a screenshot by using CTRL+CMD+SHIFT+3 . Then paste it to the comment field using CMD+V
 # A pop up screen to attach screenshot display. Then, click upload

h3. Expected Results

The screenshot thumbnail append to the comment field.
h3. Actual Results

The browser page is refresh and the comment field is cleared.

 
h3. Workaround

Open the issue not from the queue. Use https://instancename/browse/ISSUEKEY
fields.summary: Attaching a screenshot in an issue from queue screen will refresh the browser content

fields.description:
h3. Description

It's not possible to expand Jira Service Desk Queues project nav. Currently, if you try to expand, it returns automatically to the original state when clicking out.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a Service Desk project
 # Access Project's Queue
 # Try to expand Queues project nav

h2. Actual result

When you click out, the queue project nav returns to its original size in the screen.
h3. Expected result

The project queue project nav should allow expansion according to the user's need.
fields.summary: It's not possible to expand JIRA Service Desk Queues project nav in New JIRA Experience

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For Jira Service Desk notification , when comment a ticket with a table with two or more word in a column , the sentences will be wrapped and display multiple of row when vieiwing it from Outlook
h3. Environment

Outlook
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Comment a customer ticket with :-

{noformat}
|*TEST*|
|ABC connections    |32|
|Inactive             |0|
|Invalid ABC  |1|
|ABC failed    |1| {noformat}
h3. Expected Results

Notification email will display one line

!Screen Shot 2018-01-30 at 8.36.49 PM.png!

 
h3. Actual Results

The word display two line

!Screen Shot 2018-01-30 at 8.36.19 PM.png!

 
h3. Workaround

Use a different mail client , for example Thunderbird or Mac Mail Client
fields.summary: Text is wrapped in table column when viewing notification from Outlook

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the notification "From" name is set to *Jira Service Desk Widget* . 

h3. Suggested Solution

It will be better if the admin can customize and change it . Or set it using the project name. 

h3. Why this is important
At the customer end, they will not understand what is it means by Jira Service Desk widget.
fields.summary: Change Widget notification sender to Project Name
User friendly error when customer click expired invitation link

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Logo not showing in customer portal after refreshing the page.

h3.Steps to Reproduce

# Project settings;
# Portal settings;
# Click on *View and customize* (or access "View and customize" from the Help Centre /servicedesk/customer/portals page)
# Upload a new logo and save

Note: an other way of reproducing this would be to clear your cache when reloading any page and it also randomly happens)

h3.Expected Results

Logo is displayed without refreshing the page.

h3.Actual Results

Logo is not showing and the Help Centre name shows up instead.

Refresh the page or navigate away to display the configured logo.
 !Logo1.png|thumbnail! 
 !Logo2.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Refresh the page or navigate to a different page so the logo starts appearing
fields.summary: Logo not showing in customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an issue key is added to the comment section for the purpose of linking the issues, the status of the issue is not translated to the preferred language and remains in English.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure the comment is using Wiki style renderer & preferred language set to German.
# Add a comment to an issue of another issue key, eg: in ABC-123, add a comment ABC-124.
h3. Expected Results
Issue ABC-123 comment will show ABC-124 with status in German.
h3. Actual Results
Issue ABC-123 comment will show ABC-124 with status in English.
 
h3. Notes
The linked issue is not translated in both portal and agent view.

h3.Workaround
No workarounds.
fields.summary: Issue status for linked issues in comments are not translated

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Uninformative error appears when user is unable to transition tickets in the customer portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Try to transition a ticket in the customer portal with e.g. a deleted user being selected in a user picker field:  https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5532 
h3. Expected Results.

If issue cannot be transitioned, a message detailing the reason should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results.

A generic, message appears without any details as to why the issue cannot be transitioned.

!Screen Shot 2018-01-29 at 3.22.42 PM.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Workaround

Transition the issue in the agent view (from within the Jira UI)
fields.summary: JSD is not reporting correct error message when an issue cannot be transitioned from the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Requests created via Widget is sometime duplicated.
h3. Explanation

Widget is implemented as a separate HTTP service from Jira. Widget requests are created in asynchronous manner, help seeker is presented with a confirmation message even before the request is successfully created in Jira. 

On some occasions, HTTP requests to Jira timed out and Widget automatically retries the request causing duplicates.
fields.summary: Widget sometimes creates duplicate requests

fields.description:
Today an Atlassian Account user can edit their avatar from their profile in the customer portal via:
* their Atlassian Account profile page uploading a custom avatar
* Gravatar if it's enabled for the Jira application

Gravatar is supported for portal only users but not custom avatar at the moment.
fields.summary: Enable portal only users to upload custom avatars through the customer portal profile page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an issue type is changed on a ticket, it will break the request type mapping and the request type field will be displayed as _No match_. However, if the ticket is viewed in the issue navigator list view, the request type field shows the previous request type value so searching for request type null/empty would not return a value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket via the customer portal. Make sure the request type is valid.
# Change the issue type of the ticket.

h3. Expected Results
The request type shows no match and the field is empty in the issue navigator list view.
h3. Actual Results
The request type shows no match and the field shows the previous value in the issue navigator list view.
 
h3. Notes
This affect both tickets when changing the issue type directly or moving issues to own/other projects.
fields.summary: Request type field shows previous request type value in issue navigator list view

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
 * When migrating from Cloud to Server, the Request Type icons are different and cause a lot of errors

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Service Desk in Cloud
 # Create one or more Service Desk projects.
 # Create an XML Backup for Server
 # Restore the XML Backup on JIRA Server.
 # Go to the SD projects and see the Queues or the Request Types.

h5. Expected Behavior
 * The icons for the request types are shown correctly.

h5. Actual Behavior
 * There are several broken icons: !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
 * Each broken icon throws a logging error, flooding the log files pretty quickly with a File not found error:
{code:java}
2018-01-26 14:00:41,130 http-nio-8080-exec-22 ERROR      [c.a.j.web.servlet.InternalServerErrorServlet] {errorId=a375e86d-abab-4188-aa71-b262a5ddd0d2, interpretedMsg=, cause=java.io.IOException: File not found, stacktrace=java.io.IOException: File not found
        at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.AvatarManagerImpl.getAvatarInputStream(AvatarManagerImpl.java:388) [classes/:?]
        at com.atlassian.jira.avatar.AvatarManagerImpl.lambda$processAvatarData$0(AvatarManagerImpl.java:367) [classes/:?]{code}

h5. Cause
 * There are system Request Type icons in Cloud that don't exist in Server (select * from avatar where avatartype = 'SD_REQTYPE') Difference [^Request types Cloud vs server.xlsx]. When an XML backup is generated, the references to the icons and the issues that use them are include in the data. There are about double the icons in Cloud than in Server. Even though the missing icons are considered 'avatars', the request type icons are not included in the 'avatars' directory, possibly because the files are actually inside the *jira-servicedesk-xx.yy.zz.jar* file (at least on Server side), in the directory img/request-type-icons (you can find them extracting the content of the jar file with a compression tool), so when generating the Export file from Cloud, the avatars/icons for the request types are not include din the 'avatars' directory.

h5. Workaround
 * None
fields.summary: When migrating from Cloud to Server, the Request Type icons are different and cause a lot of errors

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When an image on a Confluence page contains a special character, it will not load in the knowledge base of JIRA Service Desk from the customer portal.
Note: it will load correctly if viewed:
* from Confluence
* from JSD agent view KB search/view

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Rename and image to [˚_˚].png . 
# Add it to a Confluence page.
# Integrate a JIRA Service Desk project to the Confluence space that contains the page in step 2.
# View the same Confluence page as a knowledge base from the customer portal.

h3.Expected Results
Image load properly in the knowledge base view.

h3.Current Results
Image doesn't load properly in the knowledge base view.

h3.Workaround
Rename the file by removing all special characters and and use this modified image to replace the image that is not loading in the knowledge base view.
fields.summary: Image will not load on knowledge base article from the customer portal due to special characters (known failing when "[" and "]" are in the image filename)
Image will not load on knowledge base article due to special characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting tickets that has organization field via CSV or printing details, the organization is empty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Filter ticket that has organization e.g project = TEST AND Organizations = Atlassian
# Click to export CSV or Print Details

h3. Expected Results

The field organization appears with the organization's name.

h3. Actual Results

The field is empty.
fields.summary: Field organization is empty when exporting tickets

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If agents are registered as customers and one of them opens a request shared with the rest of the organization. The default assignee doesn't get notified being assigned a ticket if we disable *Organization added* notifications from the project settings although JIRA notification schema is set to notify assignee.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk with agent are also customers within same organisation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Organization in JIRA Service Desk.
# Set a default assignee as one of the agents who is also a customer in the same organization.
# Add the agents as customers in this Organization.
# Disable *Organization added* from Customer Organization to avoid excessive notifications to users who aren't involved.
# Create a request from the customer portal that is shared with the organization.

h3. Expected Results
* Assignee gets notification being assigned a new ticket.
 
h3. Actual Results
No notification is sent to the assignee
 

h3.Workaround
* remove the agents from the same organization as the customer.
OR
* enable JIRA notifications to customers at Settings - Application - JIRA Service desk Configuration - *Yes, send customers both Jira Service Desk and Jira notifications*. But this will cause that the reporter will get two notifications for both JIRA and JSD.
fields.summary: User doesn't get notified when assigned ticket if user is a customer and agent in the same organization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in SLA report, it will include data for non working days. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best only to display working days depending on calendar selection.

h3. Why this is important
It will give a better graph because when including non working days, obviously the data is zero.
fields.summary: SLA report should only display working days as per configured in SLA calendar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no clear explanation about the usage for *Notification* setting in *JIRA Service Desk Configuration*. Go to *Cog Icon > Application > JIRA Service Desk Configuration*
{panel}
Should customers receive Jira notifications? Learn more about notifications
* No, only send Jira Service Desk notifications to customers (recommended)
* Yes, send customers both Jira Service Desk and Jira notifications
{panel}

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation and explain the usage of it. As of now, the setting for *Yes, send customers both Jira Service Desk and Jira notifications* is for agent that is treated as a customer. By enabling it , the agent also will receive notification from JIRA (as per configured in Notification Scheme) and notification from JIRA Service Desk.

h3. Why this is important
Our customer is not aware of this usage. So, need to have this to clear the understanding of the configuration.
fields.summary: Update "Managing service desk notifications" documentation about global JIRA Service Desk configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Portal only customer receives the mentioned notifications even he's the request participant.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a portal only user
# Go to *Project settings > People*, add the user to *Service Desk Team* role
# Create a new ticket (make sure the user created on Step 1 is not Reporter or Request Participant)
# Attempt to mention the user in the ticket

h3. Expected Results
Portal only customer shouldn't receive any notifications when he's not the request participant.

h3. Actual Results
Portal only customer receives both internal and external mention notifications.

h3.Workaround
Remove the user from *Service Desk Team* role
fields.summary: Customer Able to Receive Mention Notification Even Not In Request Participant List

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The resolution language is not being translated in Customer Portal even though the Resolution settings have been updated to the preferred language.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Head to resolution settings
# Click on translate resolution
# Choose preferred language and update
# Check the request in customer view

h3. Expected Results
The Resolution language will be translated into the preferred language

h3. Actual Results
The resolution language is not being translated into the preferred language
fields.summary: Resolutions are not translated on portal

fields.description:
As far as I can tell there is now way of specifying a commend is internet when using the Jira Android App. When adding a comment using the App they always show as 'Share With Customer'.

Would it be possible to have a toggle between 'Share With Customer'.and Internal comments on the App?

 

Thanks

Ben
fields.summary: Internal Comments via the Jira Android App

fields.description: Otherwise, Jira will not create the request from the email because it does not support storing the null character.
fields.summary: JSD should ignore null characters (0x00) when processing emails

fields.description:
h3. Summary

EazyBI reports do not show horizontal/vertical scrollbars on customer portal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a report in EazyBI through Jira.
# Add the report on a Confluence page.
# Add the Space as a Knowledge base on a Service Desk project.
# Search for the article on Customer Portal.

h3. Expected Results

As the report has a lot of information and the customer portal has a small space to see information, as reported here [JSDCLOUD-4923|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4923], it appears horizontal and vertical scroll bars to see the information.

h3. Actual Results

For EazyBI reports, it does not show scrollbars.
fields.summary: EazyBI reports do not show horizontal/vertical scroll bars on customer portal.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the message received by a SD email contains the key of a non SD issue and the sender has permission on the mentioned issue then a comment is added

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Software project with an issue
# Create a Service Desk project with an _Email request_
# Send an e-mail to the address set on SD project containing the key of the issue (created on step 1) on the message's subject

h3. Expected Results
A new issue is created

h3. Actual Results
A comment is added on the issue by a mail handler that should be exclusive to a Service Desk project

h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: Service Desk email adds a comment on non SD issues instead of creating a new issue

fields.description:
*Summary*

When the user satisfaction survey is sent from the Service Desk which only has one Language Support which is Italian, the satisfaction survey rating is in English. 

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Ensure the Language Support has set Italian language set as default only. 
 # Create a request in the service desk portal > Resolve and Close the ticket to generate a satisfaction survey. 
 # When checking the satisfaction survey the language in it is in English

!image-2018-01-24-22-39-11-571.png|width=513,height=169!

*Expected Results*

The satisfaction survey should be fully in Italian .'

!rating_2.png|width=471,height=160!

*Actual Results*

The satisfaction survey comes out in English language. 

*Notes:*
This affects PT-BR as well.

*Workaround*

*Method 1:*
1. Go to System Setting > General Configuration:
2. Click on Edit Settings > Change the default language to Italian > Click Update
3. Now, when customer portal tickets are resolved the satisfaction survey sent are in full Italian.

*Method 2:* 
1. Ensure that the customer profile: *Preferences* language is set to "italiano (Italia)".
2. Now, when customer portal tickets are resolved the satisfaction survey sent are in full Italian.
fields.summary: Satisfaction Survey Email Does Not Display in Italian Despite Italian/Portuguese Language Support Setting

fields.description:
*_As a Customer Support manager,_* *_I want to be able to add new custom translations in order to provide our customers with proper support level._*

 

We need to make customer portal and knowledge base for Slovenian market with Slovenian language. As we use Jira Service Desk Cloud we can't use [Translation for Jira Service Desk|https://goo.gl/hD2QHE]

We need a solution to add a new language, even if we have to translate everything manually, that is not currently on the list of supported languages.

I even tried to download Slovenian translation from [Translations@Atlassian|https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/download?lang=sl_SI#/JIRA Service Desk/3.10.0] but I can't upload it.

Any help that would resolve our issue would be very appreciated, here is the [community discussion|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-discussions/Jira-service-desk-How-to-add-new-language-ie-Slovenian/td-p/704784#U710160]
fields.summary: Ability to add new custom translation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, there are no translations available for the SLA name
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to translate SLA names
h3. Why this is important
Allows SLA to appear as the user's preferred language
fields.summary: Add the ability to translate SLA names

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If Project Key = "PROJECTS", navigating from portal view
https://INSTANCEDOMAIN/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/PROJECTS-1
to https://INSTANCEDOMAIN/projects/PROJECTS/issue/PROJECTS-1 is not possible and will show an infinite loading page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with Project Key = "PROJECTS"
# Navigate to any issues via the portal, eg: https://INSTANCEDOMAIN/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/PROJECTS-1
# Click on the Issue Key, eg: PROJECTS-1

h3. Expected Results
Page is navigated to https://INSTANCEDOMAIN/projects/PROJECTS/issue/PROJECTS-1
h3. Actual Results
Console shows error
{{Expected to find web-item by key(s) [com.atlassian.servicedesk.project-ui:sd-project-sidebar-queues,servicedesk.agent.queues], but it couldn't be found in the JIRA navigation component}}
 
h3. Notes
Issue does not exist in old Jira experience

h3.Workaround
Access to the agent view via direct link, eg: https://INSTANCEDOMAIN/browse/PROJECTS-1
fields.summary: Unable to navigate from portal view to agent view in new Jira experience when project key = PROJECTS

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to a service desk project
# Click to open the Invite Team dialog in the left hand sidebar
# Type an email that does not belong to an existing Atlassian account user (so either an existing portal-only customer or a new user).
# Submit/invite the user

h3. Expected behaviour

The invited user is added as an agent

h3. Actual behaviour

The dialog displays an error:
* For a new user: "The action performed required a logged in user. Please log in and try again."
* For an existing portal-only customer: "...UserNotFoundException..."

h3. Workaround

* For a new user: Try inviting the user again. It should succeed once their account has been created.
* For an existing portal-only customer: Go to User Management and create an Atlassian account with this user's email, then add them to the project role (either via trying the Invite Team dialog again or the People page in project settings).
fields.summary: Adding an agent via the Invite Team dialog fails when inviting new users and portal-only customers

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Go to the profile for a portal-only customer under User management > Jira Service Desk > Portal-only customers.
# Click the "Convert to Atlassian account" button in the top right.

h3. Expected behaviour

See a successful flag and redirect to the new Atlassian account user profile.

h3. Actual behaviour

The user is successfully converted, but an error flag is shown and you are not redirected to the new user's profile. Refreshing the page shows a user not found message because the user has been successfully converted.

h3. Workaround

You can get to the new user's profile at /admin/users?username=<username>
fields.summary: 'Convert to Atlassian account' action succeeds but does not redirect properly because of an exception

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, a customer would see all request types configured for a given project and the branding of the portal such as logo and background color are the same across all projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow configuring request types and portal displayed based on customer login/organization

h3. Why this is important
Customer will not choose the wrong request type in the wrong portal

h3. Workaround 
Admin needs to provide specific project customer portal link to their customer.
fields.summary: Ability to configure displayed portal design based on user login

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Update 20th December 2021*

Hi everyone,

Thanks for your continued patience with this request.

The feature is still under development and we are awaiting a dependency from another team before we can release. I'll post another update as soon as we can clarify timelines. 

Regards,
Jason and the Jira Service Management team


{panel}
Problem
 * The initial ticket is quite long as the signature is taking up space which is not useful.
 * An extra comment is added with the signature images attached which is sort of useless.

Suggestion

Checking that everything after the signature sign "--" is removed or not taken into account
fields.summary: Remove e-mail signatures from incoming mail

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the Create Issue transition is configured to fire other than the Issue Created event, it will cause the issue created via Jira to show Unknown instead of Jira

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the Create Issue transition to fire Issue Updated, publish the workflow.
# Create an issue via Jira using the Create issue button.

h3. Expected Results
Channel will show "Jira"
h3. Actual Results
Channel will show "Unknown"

h3.Workaround
Fire the Issue Created event
fields.summary: Request channel shows unknown when Create Issue transition is set to fire other but Issue Created event

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If we create a Service Desk project, if we add an assignee when creating, either with a default assignee or changing it via post-function, the SLAs that start on issue creations are not started.

This is very sensitive to configuration. We noticed that if we have the default 2 SLAs created for 'Basic' Service Desk project, only one is not started. If we delete one and create another 4, all are started.

 

This also happens when changing status and assigning at the same time and can prevent SLAs from starting or stopping.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Basic Service Desk project
 # Either add a default Assignee or add a post-function to 'Update field value' to assign the ticket to someone (the post-function must be placed before the event that triggers 'Issue Created' event
 # Don't change anything else
 # Create an issue in Customer Portal

h3. Expected Results

The issue has both SLA defined by default (Time to Resolution and Time to First Response)
h3. Actual Results

It will have only Time to Resolution, but not Time to First Response.
h3. Notes

Other changes give different results. For example, if we delete Time to First Response, then it's Time to Resolution that won't appear.
h3. Workaround

Remove the operation that's setting the assignee.
fields.summary: Assigning issue when creating/changing status prevents SLA to start/stop

fields.description:
I want to integrate the customers which opens tickets through e-mail to JSD portal with identity providers and be able to sync their data - name, password, e-mail - for better management.

No API is available for this at the moment.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to manage portal customers through identity providers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the option Current Issues under User > Current Issues will open a query for issues assigned to the user even though the user is a Service Desk customer.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow configuring the option to either list issues reported by user or assigned by user.
h3. Why this is important
It would be more intuitive for an agent to list issues reported by a customer as customers can't be assigned issues.
fields.summary: Allow configuring Current Issues option under user to show Reported issues

fields.description:
Customers can't change their avatar in the profile.
No option appears.

Console errors:
{code}
errors.js:29 messages.load.failed - {"error":"Unrecognized project: unknown"}
o @ errors.js:29
yaku.js:352 Uncaught (in promise) Unrecognized project: unknown
re.unhandledRejection @ yaku.js:352

{code}

Workaround:
Enable the Gravatar. With this feature, the change is possible.
fields.summary: Unable to Change New Avatars Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, knowledge base search only will suggest an article when user type in a complete word. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow incremental search for Knowledge base. The article will be suggested as user type in. 

h3. Why this is important
The article suggestion will be prompt and no need to wait till user type in a complete word that match with the page subject.

h3. Workaround 
Use asterix (*) symbol in before and after the text.
fields.summary: Allow incremental search for Knowledge base

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you create a custom field and set it as required in the field configuration, older created issues (before this setup) will be affected if the field is not populated. 
It won't be possible to Share the request trough the customer portal, it will be only possible to do so trough the issue page in the project.

h3. Environment
Jira Service Desk Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a custom field (tested with Select list (single choice));
# Set it as required in the field configuration;
# Go to older issues that use the same field configuration (related issue type) and click to show them in the customer portal;
# Try to share with anyone:
  * After you search a user, nothing happens when you click on *Share*, but if you use the inspect feature in your browser you will be able to see a error being triggered (click on the link from the 500 error that appears -> click on the share file): 
  {noformat}{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"Failed to validate request participants field, errors: "}],"reasonKey":"sd.request.participants.error.field.validate.failed","reasonCode":"500"}{noformat}
  

h3. Expected Results
After hitting the Share button, a participant should be added.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround
Populating the custom field in older issues (that are being affected) gets it back to working.
fields.summary: Required custom field won't allow sharing the request via customer portal

fields.description: As an Admin, I want to bulk edit Portal only customers name, email address and password.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to bulk edit customer data

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*

The user does not have a button, on the Customer Portal, like the Requests button, that should be a link to an FAQ page.

 

*Suggested Solution:*

The user needs a button link to an FAQ page and it should be available with the Service Desk requests.

 

*Workaround:*

The user needs to use the link option available.
fields.summary: Button Link for FAQ - Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently, it's too narrow when adding a page with 2 column with page tree view.


h3. Suggested Solution
* Knowledge base view from Confluence should be the same when viewing it in Customer Portal
fields.summary: Improve display of column layout with page tree view in Customer Portal

fields.description:
The customer is unable to run an "Update SLA" action after changing the values in the SLA goals. The SLA update bar goes all the way to the end and suddenly goes back, showing the exclamation point again.

Apparently, the SLA is updated successfully, however, the error remains on the screen.

 !1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: An exclamation point continues to appear after updating the SLAs

fields.description:
I have tried following curl command to access service desk rest api but it's return 401 authenticate failed error.When i access same API with login on browser directly then it is working.

curl -D- -u user:password -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" [https://xxx.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk]

 

Note:  This API is  working properly with jira user's credentials  but when i use service desk customer's credential then it is not working.

we were using this api from last few months it was working fine but from last week it is not working.
fields.summary: Jira service desk rest api authentication return 401

fields.description: Allow federated access without the use of Atlassian's Identity Manager.
fields.summary: Allow federated access

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Links to KB articles with an apostrophe in the title is replaced by other characters _'s_

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with an apostrophe in the title; eg: *user's*.
# Add a keyword *user* in the page so the word can be searched.
# Search the KB through the portal using the keyword *user*

h3. Expected Results
The link for the page shows as *user's*
h3. Actual Results
The link for the page shows as *user's*
 
h3. Notes
The wrong characters would only be shown in the title if the keyword *user*.
If we search for *user's*, the link will show as *user's* correctly.

h3.Workaround
No workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: Links to KB articles with an apostrophe in the title is replaced by other characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you do not set the permissions to let anyone send you requests trough the customer portal without logging, the link to the Help center still remains in the login page, but if you click on it, it will take you to a 404 error page:
 !Error404 in customer portal.png|thumbnail! 
 
To set those permissions, do the following:
 # In your JSD project settings -> *Customer permissions*;
 # Search for and click on *change Global settings*;
 # Search for *Can customers create their own accounts?*:
  ** check *Yes, by signing up or sending a request*.
 # After checking the previous option, it will make *Can customers access and send requests from the help center without logging in?* available:
  ** check *Yes*.
 # Go back to the project settings (back to project) -> *Customer permissions* -> *Who can access the portal and send requests to Fisrt JSD project?*:
  ** check *Anyone can send a request without logging in*.

If after those steps, the option *Who can access the portal and send requests to Fisrt JSD project?* is set as *Customers my team adds to the project*, it will result in the error as well.
 
h3. Environment
Jira Service Desk Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Access the customer portal (login page) when the permission to access and create requests without logging in is not active. 
The link to the help center will be above the login form, and when you click on it, you will be redirected to a 404 error page.

Help center link (outlined in red):
 !Help center link.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The link to the help center should be either removed or made unavailable to click.

h3. Actual Results
The link to the help center is clickable and will redirect you to a 404 error page.

h3. Workaround
With the permissions mentioned set, it will work correctly, but that would not be an option if the customer does not want it to work that way.
As another option, it seems like if your portal has a logo, this bug is masked.
fields.summary: Error 404 when clicking in the Help center link in the login page when you are not logged in.

fields.description: Currently, I can't use the widget without a login-free portal.  Our company has security concerns over opening our portal to the public.  We don't want the public to view our bugs and discussions.  Also, we don't want random people adding issues.  Forcing a login-free portal does not make sense at all.  The issue collector works just fine for people not logged in.
fields.summary: Allow widget without login-free portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you try to create an automation rule that will create a new issue as result, it won't let you confirm the creation if there is a field set as required in the field configuration of the issue type you have selected and that field is not present in the create screen. It is not restricted to any field, it will happen to any field that is required. If there are two required fields that are not present in the create screen, it is possible to see in the browser logs (inspect) that the error is triggered for both fields.

h3. Environment
Jira Service Desk Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
First choose which issuetype you will want to create in the automation rule:
 # In the project settings, go to *Fields* and edit the field configuration related to the issuetype you have chosen:
   ** Make one or more fields required, in this examples, I've tested with *Priority* and *Component/s*.
 # In the project settings again, search for the screen scheme related to the issuetype you have chosen:
   ** Remove those two fields from the create screen (Priority and Component/s).
 # In the project settings, go to *Automation*:
   ** I've created the following as example: WHEN: Issue Created | IF: Issue matches -> type = Incident | THEN: Create Issue -> make sure you select the issuetype you've been editing the configurations related to it in the creation screen that pops up;
   ** Open the inspect in your browser (I'm using Chrome). Click on *Confirm* (in the creation screen that was showed up) and you will see an error being triggered in the console:
    !POST 400().png|thumbnail! 
   ** If you click on the path outlined in red, it will take you to the network section:
    !Network.png|thumbnail! 
   ** Clicking in Validate (outlined in red), will show you the preview screen. Click on *validation* -> *fieldErrors* -> expand the field/s showed up:
    !Validation error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
If you create a issue using the *Create* button, it will create it if a required field was not added to the create screen. So it should work during an automation creation.

h3. Actual Results
Instead of being able to confirm in the creation screen, when you click on *Confirm*, it won't respond, hence, making it impossible to create the rule.

h3. Workaround
Adding the required field/s back to the create screen makes it work (of course depending on the field, you will have to set the value manually).
fields.summary: Create issue screen in automation rule won't let you confirm if a required field is not present in the create screen

fields.description:
Several aspects of the customer portal can already be localized, as described in
 [Translating your customer portal|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/translating-your-customer-portal-and-supporting-multiple-languages-886180551.html]

However, there is at least one notable exception. If the portal is set up for self-signup, the user starts the signup in a German signup screen and then gets a 95% ENGLISH mail with a confirmation link:
{quote}Title: Finish signing up to Hilfe

Almost done!

Follow the link below to finish signing up to Hilfe. For security, don't share this link with anyone.
{quote}
This is just horrible for an end customer who does not understand English, and it is horrible because there is some German word contained in an English sentence.

Please either provide a complete German translation by default or allow to customize the title/test of this email (f.e. similar to the normal issue email template).

*_Notes:_*
 This may affect all languages, not only German.
fields.summary: Send localized signup confirmation email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who have configured Jira to send [Emails on behalf of their Domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=900996548] notice that the Service Desk Customer Invitations still send as jira (at) instance.atlassian.net

h3. Suggested Solution
If the Service Desk Project has been configured to Send on Behalf of the Customer's Domain, the invitation should come from that address
It appears that the "Send on Behalf" Email Address is only used for Jira and Service Desk Notifications and not for Customer Invitations to a Project. 

Service Desk Notification: 
!SDNotification.png|thumbnail! 
Invitation: 
!Invitation.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Why this is important
A Customer's Customer may have mail filtering or may not trust the jira (at) instance.atlassian.net email
 
h3. Workaround 
The jira (at) instance.atlassian.net email address should be whitelisted to ensure mail delivery from the instance
fields.summary: Service Desk Invitation Should Send As the Custom Project Email Address

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Error when trying to convert a customer to Atlassian account.

"We're having some trouble connecting. If refreshing the page doesn't fix it, then this might be one for the experts."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On User management, click on Jira Service Desk
# Select a customer and click "Convert to Atlassian account"

h3. Expected Results

The customer is converted and the page is redirected to Users' page.

h3. Actual Results

The error "We're having some trouble connecting. If refreshing the page doesn't fix it, then this might be one for the experts." appears and the page does not refresh, but the customer is successfully converted.

Splunk:

{noformat}
Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.UserNotFoundException: User <myaccount@atlassian.com> does not exist
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes

The customer is converted, but for now, it's necessary to return to the page "Jira Service Desk" to check that the customer account is not there anymore.
fields.summary: Error when trying to convert a customer to Atlassian account

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Space in Confluence.
 # Add multiple pages to this Space.
 # Choose a single page and restrict access to _jira-servicedesk-users_ in the padlock icon.
 # Create a JIRA Service Desk project
 # Access Project settings > Knowledgebase
 # Link to the Confluence space created
 # Access Portal as user not listed at _jira-servicedesk-users_ group (customer)
 # Perform a search for the restricted page

h3. Actual Results

Customers are suggested with the restricted pages even if they are not part of _jira-servicedesk-users_ group
h3. Expected Results

The page should not be displayed to users without the permission to view the Confluence page.
h3. Workaround

Use a specific Confluence space for the knowledge base that only contains pages you wish to share with Service Desk users. Or use another group, except  _jira-servicedesk-users,_ to restrict page access in Confluence.
fields.summary: Restricted Confluence pages are being suggested to customers at Customer Portal when jira-servicedesk-users group is used to restrict page access in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Custom email address that is configured for Jira Service Desk Project stops working for a period of time and resumes after.


At the same time, incoming email processing works fine if you configure this custom email address via Jira Mail Handler:
https://<instance_hostname>/secure/admin/IncomingMailServers.jspa 



This happens because one of the configured custom emails in Jira Service Desk is suffering from overload - sudden spam surge, auto-reply loops.

As a result, none of the Jira Service Desk custom emails in the instance work for a period of time.

h3. Customer Impact

Jira Service Desk is not processing incoming emails for _all_ custom email addresses within the instance.

 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to email settings in a JSD project and assign the custom email address
2. Make your Jira Service Desk publicly accessible (anyone can raise a request)
3. Create some circumstances to have inbox of the mailbox being spammed (tested with mailbox having 10k incoming emails)
4. Jira Service Desk will stop processing any incoming emails for this mailbox and any other configured for JSD projects.

In fact Jira Service Desk continues to process incoming emails, however cannot do it fast enough to go through all the volume of 'spammed' mailbox.

h3. Expected Results

1 overloaded mailbox should not affect other JSD configured mailboxes

h3. Actual Results

Overloaded mailbox affects processing of incoming emails for all JSD custom mailboxes



h3.Workaround  

1. Disable affected JSD mailbox via JSD email request settings (remove mailbox from 'custom email address')
2. Clear all the spam/unwanted emails from Inbox
3. Switch JSD mailbox back
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk custom email address does not process incoming emails because of overloaded mailbox

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Images download as HTML from Customer Portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a .jpg image to a JSD Cloud issue
# From customer portal, attempt to download image with in-line preview window
# File downloaded is .html not .jpg

h3. Expected Results

File downloaded should be same as file uploaded

h3. Actual Results

An html file is downloaded

h3.Workaround

Right click image and select "Save image as"
fields.summary: Images download as HTML from Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers who have configured a Workflow Validator in their Service Desk Projects have noticed that the Custom Validator Error message does not appear in the Customer Portal (if the Validator fails).  

In this scenario, the validator is to ensure that Customer Requests are shared with the Customer's Organizations and are not Private

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. How to Reproduce 
h4. Prerequisites
# Update and Publish a Service Desk workflow so that a Customer Transition has a Validator (in this example, add a Validator on the Create Transition where the Organization Field must be set and a Custom Error Message if not set)
# Create and Add Customer Accounts in a Service Desk Customer Organization
 !WorkflowValidator.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Steps to Take
# As an Agent/Customer, go to the Customer Portal and create a Request where the "Organization" field is set to "Private Request"

h3. Expected Results
Error message displays the Custom Error message that is configured in the Validator

h3. Actual Results
Issue is not created and the following error is displayed:
{quote}*Error*

Your request could not be created. Please check the fields have been correctly filled in.{quote}
 !PortalError.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
If the Issue is created in Jira, the error that's displayed matches what is configured in the Workflow Validator:
 !CreateInJira.png|thumbnail! 
Note that Organization is not a field that can be edited on a Create/Edit Issue screen: Feature Request here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4723

Something like Setting the Organization by Default (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5307) may help with this scenario

h3.Workaround
No workaround available to set the Organization Field nor alert the Customer that this field must be set during the Creation of the Request

An Automation rule could be created to send out an Alert to specific Agents if the Request was created without an organization being set
fields.summary: Customer Portal Does Not Display Custom Validator Error

fields.description:
h2.Summary

While https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4391 is more on disabling of CSAT ratings, it will also be great to have a feature that allows deletion and removal of customer feedback entirely (both CSAT and worded feedback) from a specific JIRA Service Desk project. 

This will allow administrators to have more control and management on the CSAT page so that unnecessary/irrelevant feedback will not clutter up the CSAT page.
fields.summary: Ability to completely remove and purge customer feedbacks (CSAT) from a specific JIRA Service Desk project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In an Approval Workflow, we have 4 Approvers (A, B, C, D) where approval can come from A or B (not both), C and D are required, and we need 3 total Approvals. For Example approvals from ABC would not be a valid approval but ACD would be.

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option in Approvals where users can be conditional (similar to a JQL Query in the Workflow) 

h3. Workaround 
This could be done with additional workflow steps where the first Approval from A or B could transition into the second step for C and D.  The workflow would need 2 Separate Workflow Steps and 2 Approver User Picker Fields 
Request transitioned to "Approval #1" where A or B can approve using the "Consider Approved after 1 Approval(s)" condition.
If Approved, the Request is transitioned to "Approval #2" where C and D set the final approval using the "Consider approved after All approvals)."
fields.summary: Include Conditional Approval

fields.description:
Problem
When adding a comment in JIRA is only possible to 1) share with the customer or 2) comment internally.

Suggestion
It would be very useful to be able to select what groups will receive the comments added to an issue.
fields.summary: Comment visibility

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*

On the portal, the user views all of the approvals, even of other approvers, on the approvals queue.

 

*Suggested Solution:*

Allow the users to view only the approval that user needs to approve.

 

*Workaround:*

When accessing through Jira the user is able to view only the approvals this user needs to approve.

 

Example: https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-355141
fields.summary: Approval Queue - Show only the agent approvals

fields.description:
We support a highly distributed global service and need to list different components per issue type. Having a separate project is too messy to deal with. 

Is there any way the list of components for our Access Request issue type can be different to the list of components for Incident issue type? 

It would be very helpful if component list was configurable per a group of organisations too. 

Please let me know if there is any workaround for our problem.

Thanks and Regards,
fields.summary: Configure component lists per issue type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
 - Upon deactivation of Jira Service Desk, all of the projects, schemes and configuration related still resides in Jira Instance.

h3. Suggested Resolution
 - Ability to remove all of the related project, schemes and configuration that is related to Jira Service Desk once it is deactivated.
fields.summary: Ability to remove Service Desk Project and related configuration after deactivating JSD

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when customer have access to multiple projects, in Customer Portal will display a list of projects. Then, customer need to select the project and process to choose the request type. Sometimes, this will caused the customer to choose a wrong project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Able to customize customer portal to display only the request type. The request type will be tied to a project. However, "Request Type" need to be a unique name.

h3. Why this is important
Customer will not choose the wrong project.

h3. Workaround 
Admin needs to provide specific project customer portal link to their customer.
fields.summary: Ability only to display Request Type in Customer Portal despite having multiple Service Desk project

fields.description:
I noticed that in the page : [https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html] 

Under the first title : Integrate with Confluence

I have two remarks  
 # The statement " Confluence Cloud version 5.10 or later " seems wrong to me. I think we've stopped versionning our cloud products so I'm not sure we should give a version for Confluence cloud compatibility. 
 # I think it would be better, for more clarity to the customer or future customer, to precise that if Confluence cloud and JIRA Service Desk cloud are under the same cloud instance, they can skip this step as it will be integrated automatically. The way it's written now, it not made clear that if they are on the same cloud instance, they actually have nothing to do. 

Please let me know if there's a better place to make this kind of suggestion, I followed the guidelines [here|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/TECHWRITING/Report+a+documentation+bug+or+request+an+update]
fields.summary: Add a precision for integration between JIRA Service Desk and Confluence

fields.description:
When a user removes an approver from the approvers list (custom fields) he is not able to search for the issues that this approver previously approved.

 

e.g. Approvals changed by "user". This way it would return the issues that this user has previously approved, even if he is removed from the custom field approvers (since currently the only way to perform this search is by the following query: Approvals = Approver("user")
fields.summary: Abity to perform history JQL search on the field approvals and approvers

fields.description:
h2. Summary
A while ago all system request type icons were replaced with black and white icons. The only one which is the default icon is still purple

h2. Steps to reproduce
Project Settings -> Request type -> new request type

h2. Expected results
default icon has the same stile as other - black and white

h2. Actual results
default icon is purple

 !create_new_project_-_Edit_Request_Type_Group_-_Service_Desk.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Default request type icon is not black and white as all other new icons

fields.description:
The documentation https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html says that 
{quote}Yes.  Portal-only customers can view knowledge base articles in your customer portal.
To let customers to log in to Confluence and view and comment on pages in your knowledge base space, convert them to Atlassian account. Don't worry about licensing. You don't need to give them application access to Confluence. Converting a customer to Atlassian account doesn't affect your current pricing.{quote}

Which is false. You cannot grant permissions to your unlicensed customers from Jira Service Desk in Confluence without giving them application access for Confluence and so, license them.
fields.summary: Unlicensed customers cannot access Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer Portal already open to public and have set to "not required to login". However, JIRA Service Desk rest API can't be used for the anonymous user. For example {{/rest/servicedeskapi/requesttype}} API.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to use Anonymous for JIRA Service Desk API

h3. Why this is important
Match the usage of "not required to login" feature. For more information can refer https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/04/introducing-the-login-free-portal documentation.

h3. Workaround 
Provide "Authorization" value, for example, use customer login and password.
fields.summary: Allow Anonymous Authorization for JIRA Service Desk API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no setting to send a notification to customer when a new page created in Knowledge-Based.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to send a notification to customer when new page created.

h3. Why this is important
 Awareness to the customer .
h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Notify customer when new page created in Knowledge Base

fields.description:
Hello

I am having an issue getting my read file for Kennedale to drop in the billing upload folder again. It general is supposed to take 15 minutes to upload however it has been taking more than 2+ hours at times. Today it has been about 2 hours already. Can you please check to see if there is anything that is holding it up or if I need to create the file again. See below screenshots of where the file should drop at. Also this is the file name used when creating the read file. \\azrncckenprd01\kennedale billing\download\download.dat

 

!image-2017-12-27-09-18-58-008.png|width=527,height=387!

 

 

Thanks

Carmen
fields.summary: Retrieving Read Files: Kennedale

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an anonymous creates a ticket, a confirmation message will be shown to inform that the ticket is created and a confirmation is sent to the inserted email address. This message, however, is hardcoded and will follow the reporter browser language.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admins to edit the confirmation message.
h3. Why this is important
Different organizations has different preferences to how the confirmation message is delivered. Allowing admins to edit their own messages would allow the to suit their business.
fields.summary: Ability to edit/translate the anonymous created request confirmation message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to raise a new request, the page is showing blank.

h3. Customer Impact
No one can raise new request from customer portals

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set the profile language to non-English like Chinese, Russian, Japanese, etc
# Go to customer portal
# Click on any project
# Click on any request type

h3. Expected Result
A form with list of fields is showing so users can fill in the form to raise the request.
!screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Actual results
A blank page is showing

h3. Notes
* The pages are working when using English as the profile language.
* This also happens when trying to view the request when using non-English as the profile language.

On Browser Console:
!screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '_attach' of undefined
    at _applyInlineAttachPresenter (cv.request.create.chunk.2ce998181e90d9714e09.js:1)
    at HTMLInputElement.<anonymous> (cv.request.create.chunk.2ce998181e90d9714e09.js:1)
    at Function.each (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:sourcemap:23)
    at init.each (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:sourcemap:16)
    at Object.inlineAttach (cv.request.create.chunk.2ce998181e90d9714e09.js:1)
    at d.onRender (cv.request.create.chunk.2ce998181e90d9714e09.js:1)
    at d.c.triggerMethod (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:sourcemap:3442)
    at d.render (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:sourcemap:3458)
    at servicedesk-customerportal.bundle.a96991316c73a630d71c.js:1
    at Function.m.each.m.forEach (servicedesk-customerportal.bundle.a96991316c73a630d71c.js:1)
{code}


h3. Workaround
Support Team confirmed non-English users (such as Chinese and Japanese) are affected.
If you are still affected, go to Profile page and change your language setting to "English" (UK or US).
https://__EXAMPLE__.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/profile
fields.summary: Customer Portal is Showing Blank

fields.description: We would like to share the issue to the customer via add the customer into the request participant. Unfortunately ., there is not email notify to the customer email and also there is not issue display on the customer portal. Please kindly suggest.
fields.summary: Issue with customer participants not display on the customer portal

fields.description:
I want to bring to your notice that we at Rivigo Labs are facing an issue regarding the unnecessary duplicate tickets which are generated in bulk even when the ticket for that subject has been 'closed' or 'done'. I kindly request you to check this issue and provide an efficient solution for this and get it fixed soon.
I am providing an instance below for the same:
original ticket: [PTS-62117|https://rivigolabs.atlassian.net/browse/PTS-62117]
duplicate ticket: 
 # [PTS-62180|https://rivigolabs.atlassian.net/browse/PTS-62180]
 # [PTS-62181|https://rivigolabs.atlassian.net/browse/PTS-62181]
 # [PTS-62183|https://rivigolabs.atlassian.net/browse/PTS-62183]
 # [PTS-62136|https://rivigolabs.atlassian.net/browse/PTS-62136]
 # [PTS-62135|https://rivigolabs.atlassian.net/browse/PTS-62135]
 # [PTS-62134|https://rivigolabs.atlassian.net/browse/PTS-62134]
 # [PTS-62132|https://rivigolabs.atlassian.net/browse/PTS-62132]
 # [PTS-62121|https://rivigolabs.atlassian.net/browse/PTS-62121]
 # [PTS-62120|https://rivigolabs.atlassian.net/browse/PTS-62120]
 # [PTS-62118|https://rivigolabs.atlassian.net/browse/PTS-62118]
