fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the customer doesn't have the visibility how many tickets the agent still need to work on until they available to work on the customer ticket. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a feature like ticketing numbering in Customer Portal. The number will display how many existing ticket needed agent to work on until available to attend the customer ticket.

h3. Why this is important
 Customer have awareness how long they need to wait until their ticket will be attend. 
h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Able to display number of existing ticket for Agent to work on in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, site-admins do not have the permission to edit the email address of the portal-only accounts

h3. Suggested Solution
As the portal-only accounts are not associate with the Atlassian Accounts, it should allow site-admins to edit the email address of the accounts

h3. Why this is important
Currently, admin nor owner can change the email address of the accounts: [JSDCLOUD-4346|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4346]. One of these functionalities is needed as some users need to change the email address due to the change of domain name, etc.
fields.summary: Allow Admin to Edit the Email Address of Portal-only Accounts

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the Property jira.permission.comment.projectrole is added to a status to restrict customers to comment on it, comments performed by email channel will create new issues.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Property jira.permission.comment.projectrole to the closed status of an issue, restricting the customer to add comments
 # Create an issue through the customer portal and drag it to the status Closed
 # Try to comment on the issue through the email channel as a customer

h3. Expected Results

Basically, the comment should not be added to the issue.
h3. Actual Results

The comment sent is not added to the issue, however, a new issue is created with the email sent
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Property jira.permission.comment.projectrole cause duplicate tickets to be created by email

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Transitions in  custom made transitions in the customer portal are not translated to the used Customer portal language.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create workflow and create transitions in French, German, ..etc.   
# Change the language of the customer portal to any other language eg. German.
# Change the customer portal settings to English when viewing the requests.

h3. Expected Results
The transitions are translated to English.

h3. Actual Results
The transition name are not translated to English.


h3.Workaround
No workarounds.
fields.summary: Customer made Workflows transitions aren't translated.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In cases where the value for an request type is in a state unexpected by the database (eg: after imports/exports of data) then it is not possible to move an issue to change its type. An inconsistent value for a request type will present as "No Match" in the issue view (unfortunately this means it is indistinguishable from an empty Request Type without examining the database with the help of support). 

If the Request Type field is in the Edit screen for that issue, you won't be able to save any edits in edit screen either.

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Moving problem:
* Modify the value of the customfield of an issue with a valid Request Type in the DB to something of the format "sometext/moretext". 
* Attempt to move the issue to a new issue type.

Editing problem:
* Modify the value of the customfield of an issue with a valid Request Type in the DB to something of the format "sometext/moretext". 
* Add Request Type to Edit Screen for that issue
* Edit the issue (not inline, click the 'Edit' button)
* Try to save it


h3. Expected Results
"Move" and "Edit" processes complete successfully
h3. Actual Results
"Move" gets stuck in the "Update Fields" step validating the Request type field (no error shown). "Edit" will keep refreshing as we click 'Update'
h3. Workarounds
If the request type field says "No Matches" in the issue view, try setting it to a random value and then remove the value to clear out the invalid request type.
fields.summary: Inconsistent database value for Request Type prevents "moving" issues to a different type and "editing"

fields.description:
h3. Problem: 
In queues which are large, when navigating the pages within a queue (selecting a page number or using next/previous) the page will lock up if the queue state is modified (request added/removed) while loading the data for the next page to view. This problem is more likely to occur the longer it takes to load the queue data. So in large queues (several thousand requests) this happens much more often because loading the results of the queue takes longer.

h3. Workaround
Either: 
1. Refresh the page
OR 
2. Delete the blanket HTML element and continue navigating. Instructions for this in Chrome: Right click on the disabled page -> click "Inspect" -> delete element highlighted (should look like "<div class='sd-table-blanket' ...")
fields.summary: Page navigation locks up in queues which are large and active

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*

JIRA Service Desk does not allow to configure the same e-mail account for different projects for e-mail requests.

 

*Suggested Solution:*

Allow the users to configure the same e-mail address for different projects for JIRA Service Desk.

 

*Why is this important:*

When working on a lot of projects it makes hard to manage a lot of different e-mail accounts.

 

*Workaround:*

Each project is configured with its unique e-mail account.
fields.summary: One email account for different projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a request is moved from a non Service Desk project to a Service Desk project, the organization field is not updated automatically even though the reporter belongs to an existing organization.
h3. Suggested Solution
Populate the organization field automatically if the reporter belongs to an existing organization.
h3. Why this is important
Allows other customers belonging to the organization access to the request automatically upon issue being moved.
fields.summary: Populate Organization value based on reporter when moving issues

fields.description: As a Service Desk admin, I would like to have the ability to paginate the forms of Request Types.
fields.summary: Ability to configure a pagination for large forms

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user creates their account using uppercase characters in their Email address, it causes some of the functionalities in Jira to misbehave. This seems to affect functionalities related to customers. For now, two of the identified functionalities affected are 
 # The ability of a customer to share issues on the portal with other customers.
 # Whenever the Jira Toolkit custom field *Company* is used in searches or filters, there is a chance that all related result where the company name matches the reporter domain would not be returned. Raised in JRACLOUD-68095

h3. Steps to Reproduce 1
 # Create a customer with uppercase characters. For example, <Shakiru.Ayanloye@atassian.com>
 # Add the customer to a customer organization you have access to
 # Create an issue via your own customer portal
 # Try sharing the issue with the earlier created customer. In this case <Shakiru.Ayanloye@atassian.com>
 # Nothing happens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 2

# Refer to JRACLOUD-68095 steps to reproduce
h3. Expected Results

The issue should be shared with the customer and the customer name appear under participants.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.
h3. Workaround

Changing the customer email address to lowercase should resolve this.
fields.summary: Emails or usernames containing uppercase characters cause some features to misbehave

fields.description: We are given a application. which is something like browser. but there is no any address field in it but It opens web pages and controlled by external application. We are able to see the Source of that page. since It is a application we have tried to automate it with AutoIT but the content of that application is a webpage .So, we are not able to inspect each elements from AutoIT. kindly provide any solution.
fields.summary: How to extract from a browser

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When editing automation rule, jql helper show request type from all projects instead of filtering out only this project (like it's done in Queues and Reports)

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create new Automation rule
# Add Issue matches IF
# Go to Advance jql
# Use request type in ()

h2. Expected results
Only request types from current project is displayed

h2. Actual results
Request types from all projects are listed
fields.summary: Automation jql filter exposes Request types from other projects

fields.description:
*To reproduce*

Go to request type settings, set a field to be required. Problem was observed when setting Labels, Attachment, Priority, Due date fields. It seems to be field-agnostic.

*Expected*

Clear message why the field cannot be set to be required is shown explaining the failure reason

*Actual*

Nothing happens. Browser console reported a 412 PUT [https://gerrytan.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/98/request-type-fields/visible/411] error.
fields.summary: Error message is not displayed if request type is used by email channel and admin is trying to enable jira fields

fields.description:
# Create a new project from basic project template or use an existing project which is created from basic project template
 # Go to project setttings->automation
 # Create a new rule
 # Choose blueprint "Triage email requests"
 # Check automation rule create page

 

Expect

then action should be set with correct request type (IT Help)

 

Actual

Request type in then action not been set properly.
fields.summary: Then action got validation error when create automation rule from blueprint "triage email requests" on basic project template

fields.description:
We are currently using your service desk for our clients to report issues, and we've had a few clients complaining that when they are hitting the backspace key to edit the content they've entered, it takes them back a page and they loose everything.

If there could be an "are you sure" message that appears before it takes them back a page, or something like that, then this would hopefully solve the problem.

Thanks
Sean
Waste Logics
fields.summary: Request for a warning message when leaving page once content is entered
